channel.title: Few things

item.title: Few things
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

Hi,

You’re using really high coordinates. If you want to macro; you’ll have to select a client.
Once you have selected it, all the coordinates will be relative to the client’s left top. (So 0,0 is the left top of your selected client, not the entire desktop screen)

That will probably explain your problem. It is adding your coordinates (1750, 129) to the left of the client. Together these are probably larger than your monitor.

About the suggestion, I think it should open them in a new tab by default. See this article: http://wizzup.org/simbadoc/features/settings.html#script-tabs

Also, for scripting tutorials etc, you may want to (for now anyway, there isn’t much on mopar atm) check the srl forum (villavu.com)

Read full topic

item.title: Few things
item.dc:creator: @Pouch Pouch
item.description:
@Pouch wrote:

I made a script, keeps clicking the edge of my moniter screen.
it makes you hold and move it to the screen you want it to go to… then release.

anyways this is my developing script not finished, but hoping that you would help me fix it or mabey it’s a simba ide problem.

[CODE]program plank;

var
w, h, x, y: integer;
begin
getclientdimensions(w,h);
MoveMouse(1750, 129);
getmousepos(x, y);
ClickMouse(1750, 129, mouse_Left);
Sleep(100);
MoveMouse(1863, 187);
getmousepos(x, y);
ClickMouse(1863, 187, mouse_Left);
MoveMouse(2057, 182);
getmousepos(x, y);
ClickMouse(2057, 182, mouse_Left);
MoveMouse(2016, 121);
getmousepos(x, y);
ClickMouse(2016, 121, mouse_Left);
MoveMouse(2007, 120);
getmousepos(x, y);
ClickMouse(2007, 120, mouse_Left);
MoveMouse(2022, 123);
getmousepos(x, y);
wait(200);
ClickMouse(2022, 123, mouse_Left);
MoveMouse(1589, 115);
getmousepos(x, y);
ClickMouse(1589, 115, mouse_Left);
ClickMouse(1589, 115, mouse_Right);
end.[/CODE]

and suggestion:
when u open a current simba file, make it in a new tab not the one ur using while programming.

Read full topic
